If i reinstall the JRE (1.4.2 or 1.5 it doesn't matter)(WITHOUT make any change on the eclipse directory), the first time i run eclipse it's ok... until i exit from eclipse and run again...

This kind of error happens when the jar file is corrupted.
Could you please check that you can read it with a software like Winzip or 7zip when you get the error?
What VM are you using? I have never seen this before.

I used JVM downloaded from Sun (jdk 1.4.2_12 and jdk 1.5.0_08)
I have made a number of installations of this JVMs (uninstall, reboot, reinstall...)
Each time the problem comes again.
I use Fsecure and i have a lot of applications on my PC without any trouble.
Jbuilder works fine with a JVM 1.3.1 included with it  (but it's a old version and i prefer to use Eclipse...)

You didn't answer the comment 1 question: are you able to open this jar (C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_08\lib\rt.jar) using a software like Winzip or 7zip?
This is necessary to understand what happen there, thx

To answer the question : i can open the jar files with 7ZIP.
but : 
after a lot of trys, it seems to be a bug of the java installation.

what i did : desinstall and re-install the jvm 1.5.0 and then copy the folder C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_08 (and jre) to a other location (on D:\java...); 
I use now an eclipse.bat to start eclipse:
@echo off
set JAVA_HOME=D:\Java\jdk1.5.0_08
set ECLIPSE_HOME=D:\Eclipse32\eclipse
PATH=%JAVA_HOME%\jre\bin;%PATH%
start "Eclipse" %ECLIPSE_HOME%\eclipse.exe -showlocation

I can't anyway explain exactly why my jvm becomes corrupted, but this "patch" seems working.

It's not a eclipse's bug...
"d?sol? pour le d?rangement...".
Ren?.
